entry.title: sitespeed.io 25.3.2
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Another go at fixing the preWarmServer issue #3683.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 25.3.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to Browsertime 16.11.1 that fixes the preWarmServer issue reported in #3682.

entry.title: browsertime 16.11.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Fixed --preWarmServer so it works with --headless, Docker and specific Android or iOS device #1815.

entry.title: throttle 4.0.3
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Fixed --version so it actually shows the version again #75.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 25.3.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated to Firefox 102 and Edge 103 in the Docker container.
  • Updated to Browsertime 16.11.0.

Fixed

  • Updated to Browsertime 16.10.1 that checks that the CDP port is not used before claiming it.

entry.title: browsertime 16.11.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Firefox 102 and Edge 103 in the Docker container.
  • Use Edgedriver 103 #1812

Fixed

  • Upgraded to Selenium 4.3.0 #1813.

entry.title: browsertime 16.10.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Verify that the CDP port is free before using it 1811.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 25.2.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Bug fix for adding custom CSS from plugins, than you Josh Duncan for PR #3679.

entry.title: browsertime 16.10.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Upgraded the Docker container to use Chrome 103.
  • Upgraded to Chromedriver 103.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 25.2.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated the Docker container to use Chrome 103.

entry.title: throttle 4.0.2
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • The E6 Module convertion in 4.0 broke version check (--version) making installs failed. PR #74 is a temporaty fix for that.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 25.1.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to Browsertime 16.9.1 that upgraded to Throttle 4 that internally uses ip route instead of route (one less dependency).

entry.title: browsertime 16.9.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to Throttle 4 that internally uses ip route instead of route (one less dependency) #1767.

entry.title: throttle 4.0.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Removed the dependecy of route. Using ip route instead and we already have ip as a requirement.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 25.1.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated Browsertime to 16.9.0 with the following changes:

entry.title: browsertime 16.9.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • New wait.byCondition command. Thank you Icecold777 for PR #1803.
  • Collect number of CPU longtasks before largest contentful paint #1806.

Fixed

  • Instead of throwing errors and exit the tests if the page hasn't finished loading after 5 minutes, we now gracefully ends the test after 2 minutes (you can change that time with --maxLoadTime). That makes more sense than just throwing errors #1810.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 25.0.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Added Firefox 101 and Edge 102 in the Docker container.

Fixed

  • Updated to Axe-core 4.2.2 #3673

Changed

entry.title: browsertime 16.8.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Fix for getting the MOZ log, thank you Gregory Mierzwinski for PR #1802.
  • Removed unused functionality of the Visual metrics portable script.

entry.title: browsertime 16.8.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Add --debug mode. Debug mode will run your tests and open devtools in Chrome/Edge/Firefox on desktop and will stop after each iteration so you can inspect the page. You can add your own breakpoint in your script with the breakpoint(name) command. To continue after your breakpoint, add the following code in the developer console in your browser: window.browsertime.pause=false; #1798.
  • Use Selenium WebDriver 4.2.0 #1801.
  • Updated to Firefox 101, Edge 102, Chrome 102 in the Docker container.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 24.9.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated the Docker container to use Chrome 102 #3665.

entry.title: sitespeed.io 24.8.1
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated to Browsertime 16.7.0 from 16.4.0. With the latest versions we get:
  • You can now use groupAlias directly in a text file #3655. You can read how in the updated documentation.
  • Added an option for using the full Graphite namespace when latest screenshots/video is stored for a test #3660.
  • If you set a user agent for Browsertime, also use it for the crawler #3652.
  • Fix missing browser info when storing latest run data #3658.

Fixed

  • Better fix for getting the correct browser name and version when storing latest run data #3661.

entry.title: browsertime 16.7.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Include last CPU long task in the HAR file so we can show when it happens #1793.
  • Inlclude TTFB and INP in the Google Web Vital namespace #1792.

entry.title: browsertime 16.6.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Implemented experimental Interaction to next paint that's useful if you test user journeys #1791.
  • Track when the last CPU long task happen as explained by Andy Davies of the webperf Slack channel #1789.

entry.title: coach-core 7.1.2
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.4.2 and Third Party Web 0.17.1.

entry.title: pagexray 4.4.2
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Added missing SSL timings to the time per domain #117

entry.title: throttle 3.1.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Updated minimist dependency.

entry.title: throttle 4.0.0
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Updated dev dependencies to latest versions #68

Changed

  • Converting the project to ES6 module. If you run Throttle by command line it will work exactly as before except that we dropped support for NodeJS 10 #67. You can read Sindre Sorhus ESM package guide.

entry.title: coach-core 7.1.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.4.1 and Third Party Web 0.15.0.

entry.title: pagexray 4.4.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Bumped minimist to 1.2.6

entry.title: coach-core 7.1.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.0.0.
  • Upgraded to third party web 0.13.0.

entry.title: pagexray 4.4.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Fallback if mime types aren't mapped and use file endings. At the moment we fallback for some of the font types #109.

entry.title: chrome-har 0.13.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Add _isLinkPreload on the request object if it is isLinkPreload #94.

entry.title: throttle 3.1.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Add support for setting packet loss. Add --packetLoss and set the loss in percentage.

entry.title: coach-core 7.0.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated third-party-web to 0.12.6.
  • Use Chrome(ium) render blocking information to know if a request is render blocking or not #66.
  • Report offending JavaScript assets if the JavaScript max limits kicks in #70.
  • New largest contentful paint advice #76.
  • New first contentful paint advice #77.
  • Added TBT in the CPU longtask advice #80.
  • Report content and transfer size for offending URLs #81.
  • Report offending assets with transfer/content size for page size limit #82.

Fixed

  • Fix cases when JQuery is undefined. Thank you shubham jajodia for PR #64.
  • A better way to find offending layout shifters. Thank you shubham jajodia for PR #65.
  • Removed mentions aboout server push #69
  • Added more information on how to debug CPU advice #71.

Changed

  • Moved AMP advice to best practice instead of privacy #67.
  • Increased favicon max size advice from 5 to 10 kb #68
  • Renamed the fastRender advice to avoidRenderBlocking #73
  • Remove the third party async advice #74
  • Updated the layout shift advice to use cumulative layout shift #75
  • Changed id of the Google Tag Manager advice #79

entry.title: coach 7.0.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated to use latest Coach core and Browertime.

entry.title: coach 6.4.3
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated to use latest Browsertime with latest Chromedriver
  • Updated Docker container to use latest Chrome/Firefox
  • Use Browsertime 11.0.0
  • Use Coach-code 6.0
  • Use latest Firefox and Chrome

entry.title: throttle 3.0.0
entry.summary:
Changed

  • When you run on Mac OS we changed so localhost traffic is not throttled by default. To throttle on localhost use --localhost. This makes sence if you use WebDriver to drive your browser on your local machine. And Mac OS now works the same as Linux.

entry.title: throttle 2.1.2
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Fix breakage when multiple default routes are declared , thank you Andy Richardson for PR #62.

entry.title: coach-core 6.4.3
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Updated to latest PageXray and Third patrty web 0.12.4.

entry.title: pagexray 4.3.1
entry.summary:
Added

  • Added missing in_body_parser_blocking render blocking info for Chrome.

entry.title: coach-core 6.4.2
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Make sure JQuery refs are set back to original ref #62 see #61.

entry.title: coach-core 6.4.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Use all headers for Wappalyzer (before only the main document was used) #60.

entry.title: coach-core 6.4.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated to PageXray 4.2.0 that adds support for getting render blocking info in Chrome.
  • Update wappalyzer-core from 6.5.32 to 6.6.0 #57

Fixed

  • Only look for GET request for private and caching headers #55. See #53.

entry.title: pagexray 4.3.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Include request method per asset #105.

entry.title: pagexray 4.2.0
entry.summary:
Added

Fixed

entry.title: coach-core 6.3.2
entry.summary:
Fixed

entry.title: pagexray 4.1.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Attach Google Web Vitals data from Browsertime #101.

entry.title: throttle 2.1.1

Fixed

  • A better check for missing net-tools on Linux, thank you Radu Micu for the PR #56.

entry.title: pagexray 4.0.0

Changed

entry.title: chrome-har 0.11.12
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Removed test directory from the release, thank you Yury Michurin for the PR #75.

entry.title: chrome-har 0.11.11
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Fix: Optional cookie object, see PR 73. Thank you Michael Dijkstra.

entry.title: chrome-har 0.11.10
entry.summary:
Added

  • Parse extra info events (parse extra request data from the Network.requestWillBeSentExtraInfo event and parse extra response data from the Network.responseReceivedExtraInfo event), thank you Michael Dijkstra for the PR #71.
  • Update to day-js 1.8.31.

entry.title: chrome-har 0.11.9
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Updated dependencies: dayjs - 1.8.27, debug: 4.1.1, tough-cookie - 4.0.0, uuid - 8.0.0

entry.title: coach 5.0.0
entry.summary:
Changed

  • We moved out the core functionality to coach-core. This makes it easy to use the Coach in your own code.

entry.title: chrome-har 0.11.7
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • And excluded the shrinkwrap file again.

entry.title: chrome-har 0.11.6
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Exclude the test folder from the release.

entry.title: coach 4.4.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to Browsertime 8.0.1

entry.title: humble 0.2.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Updated throttle frontend to latest version where you can see throttling profiles set by using the API and with custom throttling support.

entry.title: compare 1.0.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Added support for using Github gists see #34.
  • Added support for using a config file to configure which HARs to test.
  • Added support for copy/paste directly you HAR, configuration file or a gist URL or id.
  • Refactor the CSS into Sass, development build process now uses BrowserSync.
  • Service worker added for offline support. Workbox is used to achieve this.
  • Added support for showing changes in request/responses if you compare the same page #63.

Changed

  • New internal structure and use the new configuration object all the way.

entry.title: compare 0.6.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Sort CPU events by name to make it easier to spot regressions
  • Upgraded to latest release of template7
  • Added more Visual Metrics.
  • Upgrad to PageXray 2.4.0

entry.title: compare 0.5.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Layout -> Rendering in latest Browsertime.
  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.5.2 fixiing Edge tab bug

entry.title: compare 0.5.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • CPU metrics are now showed automatically.
  • Styled the PageXray info table to make it easier to read.

entry.title: compare 0.4.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Major code refactoring to make it easier to do changes in the future.
  • Uploading files failed on Firefox.

entry.title: compare 0.4.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.4.1
  • You can change/upload HAR files when you already compare two HARs.

Fixed

  • The layout in the PageXray table was dependent of the length of the URL. That could make some pages look really bad.

entry.title: compare 0.3.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Automatically load the HAR files if both files are given in the URL . Thanks Ivru for the PR #15.
  • You can automatically load one HAR file by adding ?har1=URL&compare=1 as the full URL.
  • Updated to PageXray 2.2.1
  • You can now drag and drop one HAR file with multiple pages and compare the pages with each others #16.

entry.title: compare 0.2.1
entry.summary:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.2.2 that makes HAR files from WebPageTest Linux render
  • Log errors to the console

entry.title: compare 0.2.0
entry.summary:
Added

  • Upgraded to PageXray 2.1.0 and added more CPU metrics
